outtro.p: If you ended up with the answer {{var}} = {{distractor}} instead, it's likely that you didn't see the parentheses on the left-hand side of the equation. This is a common error that usually leads to an incorrect answer because the order of operations (parentheses come first!) was not followed in simplifying both sides of the equation.

Simplifying both sides of an equation before solving it is always a useful first step. Here, the multiplication by {{a}} by the quantity ( {{b}} ) can be simplified using the distributive property of multiplication over addition:

(If your answer was {{var}} = {{distractor2}}, this is probably what you did.)
